TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WebPartVerbCollection extends System.Collections.ReadOnlyCollectionBase

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of custom Web Parts verbs. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Web Parts verbs are interactive user interface (UI) elements that are displayed in a menu or title bar of a Web Parts control. A Web Parts zone provides to a Web Parts control a standard set of verbs that are rendered in the Web Parts verb menu. A custom Web Parts zone or a Web Parts control can add additional verbs to this menu.
ASP.NET provides several standard verbs by default to all controls in a Web Parts zone, including the close and minimize verbs. There are standard verbs for opening, closing, editing, and minimizing a control, and other verbs for exporting a definition for the control or loading a Help file.
You can create new verbs that are added to the Web Parts verb menu. A control can inherit from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> base class and add <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerb> objects to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection> collection. This collection can then be added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.Verbs%2A> collection of the control.
A control can also implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.IWebActionable> interface and override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.IWebActionable.Verbs%2A> property. You can then use a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection> collection to add custom verbs to a control.
This class implements <xref:System.Collections.ReadOnlyCollectionBase>, which provides a non-generic, read-only collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor creates an empty <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection> object. To create a new instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection> using an existing collection of Web Parts verbs, you can use <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection.%23ctor%28System.Collections.ICollection%29>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.ICollection verbs) cil managed

Docs.param: An object derived from that contains a set of Web Parts verbs.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor creates an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection> using the specified verbs collection. This collection can be any object derived from <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> that contains a set of Web Parts verbs.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection existingVerbs, class System.Collections.ICollection verbs) cil managed

Docs.param: An object derived from that contains a set of Web Parts verbs.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified collections.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor can be used to combine two Web Parts verb collections.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Contains(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerb value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Searches the Web Parts verb collection for the specified object.
Docs.returns: if the collection contains the Web Parts verb; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information on using this method, see its base method, <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.System%23Collections%23IList%23Contains%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerb[] array, int index);

Docs.param: The array that elements are to be copied to.
The index where copying should begin.
Docs.summary: Copies elements of the collection to the specified array, starting at the specified index.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information on using this method, see <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

Docs.summary: Specifies an empty collection that you can use instead of creating a new one. This static field is read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A static, read-only, empty instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection> reduces memory usage in cases where you want an empty collection instance to return the proper object type from a method or to compare the instance with another object, but you do not need to add members to the instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 IndexOf(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerb value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Searches for the specified Web Parts verb and returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence within the entire collection.
Docs.returns: The index of the Web Parts verb.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information on using this method, see <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.System%23Collections%23IList%23IndexOf%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

Docs.param: The index value of the Web Parts verb to be retrieved.
Docs.summary: Gets a Web Parts verb from the collection at the specified index.
Docs.value: A Web Parts verb from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this property to get a Web Parts verb if you know the index of the verb in the collection. You can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection.Contains%2A> or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to locate a particular verb in the collection.
